item.title: Julie add a quote by Norman Mailer
item.description: "There is no greater impotence in all the world like knowing you are right and that the wave of the world is wrong, yet the wave crashes upon you." -- Norman Mailer

item.title: Julie add a quote by J. Krishnamurti
item.description: "It is no measure of health to be well adjusted to a profoundly sick society." -- J. Krishnamurti

item.title: Julie add a quote by Andy Rooney
item.description: "Making duplicate copies and computer printouts of things no one wanted even one of in the first place is giving America a new sense of purpose." -- Andy Rooney

item.title: Julie add a quote by E. E. Cummings
item.description: "I'm living so far beyond my income that we may almost be said to be living apart." -- E. E. Cummings

item.title: Julie add a quote by Peter De Vries
item.description: "The murals in restaurants are on par with the food in museums." -- Peter De Vries

item.title: Julie add a quote by Ayn Rand
Julie add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "Let me give you a tip on a clue to men's characters: the man who damns money has obtained it dishonorably; the man who respects it has earned it." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Julie add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Laughter and tears are both responses to frustration and exhaustion. I myself prefer to laugh, since there is less cleaning do to do afterward." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Julie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The public is wonderfully tolerant. It forgives everything except genius." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Julie add a quote by Thomas A. Edison
item.description: "I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work." -- Thomas A. Edison

item.title: Julie add a quote by Al Capone
item.description: "You can go a long way with a smile. You can go a lot farther with a smile and a gun." -- Al Capone

item.title: Julie add a quote by Kami Garcia
item.description: "I stared at the creased map on my wall, the thin green line connecting all the places I had read about. There they were, all the cities of my imaginary future, held together with tape and marker and pins. In six months, a lot had changed. There was no thin green line that could lead me to my future anymore. Just a girl." -- Kami Garcia
